WorkItem.Description:
I have been tracing some problems with the Southridge "DataGrid" sample (the grid does not populate with data). The problem was I had the solution set to "Any CPU" but I had 32 bit SQL Server Compact Edition Binaries (which installed with VS 2008). After I did some testing, in which I created a console app and created an ADO.NET entity referecing the Southridge db. As soon as I instanciated the Entity an exception was immediatly thrown: "The specified store provider cannot be found in the configuration, or is not valid." 
Â 
After some KB / BLOG searches I found that I needed to change the platform to x86 (or possibly install the 64 bit version).
WorkItem.Summary: SSCE provider exceptions in Windows Vista x64 and Windows 7 x64
